words.definition: An asset is a skill or quality that is useful or valuable.
words.example: The coach realized the boy’s speed was an asset to the team.

words.definition: An aspect is one part or feature of something.
words.example: I thought about the different aspects of owning two dogs.

words.definition: Braille is a system of raised patterns on paper that allows the blind to read.
words.example: The boy enjoyed reading his favorite books written in Braille.

words.definition: A bud is a part of a plant that turns into a flower or a leaf.
words.example: Two weeks after planting the seed, a small bud appeared.

words.definition: To coordinate things is to make different parts work together.
words.example: Each skating team had to coordinate their movements for the show.

words.definition: To disprove something means to show that it is not true.
words.example: The scientist disproved the theory that the sun moved around the Earth.

words.definition: If something is humanitarian, it is connected to helping people’s lives.
words.example: After the flood, several humanitarian organizations offered help.

words.definition: A hypothesis is an idea that is suggested as an explanation but has not yet been proven.
words.example: The scientist has a hypothesis about why the birds migrate south.

words.definition: An imprint is a mark made by pressing something onto a surface.
words.example: The boot left an imprint in the soft mud.

words.definition: When something is informative, it provides a lot of useful information.
words.example: The documentary was very informative about the history of Egypt.

words.definition: When something is optic, it relates to the eyes or sight.
words.example: Fiber optic cables use light to carry information.

words.definition: A premise is an idea that you accept as true and use as a base for developing other ideas.
words.example: The movie is based on the premise that aliens live among us.

words.definition: A rack is an object with bars that is used to hold things.
words.example: I put my bike on the bike rack outside the library.

words.definition: The Renaissance was a period in European history when there was a new interest in art and literature.
words.example: Leonardo da Vinci was a famous artist during the Renaissance.

words.definition: To revere someone means to respect and admire them very much.
words.example: Many people revere Mother Teresa for her work with the poor.

words.definition: When things are simultaneous, they happen at exactly the same time.
words.example: The two explosions were simultaneous.

words.definition: A skeptic is a person who doubts things that other people believe.
words.example: He is a skeptic and doesn't believe in ghosts.

words.definition: Spatial relates to the amount of space that something occupies.
words.example: The architect had to think about the spatial layout of the building.

words.definition: To specify something means to state it clearly and exactly.
words.example: Please specify which color you want the walls to be.

words.definition: Wax is a solid substance used for making candles.
words.example: The candle was made of yellow wax.
